org.boon.datarepo.impl

Class RepoBuilderDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.boon.datarepo.impl.RepoBuilderDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RepoBuilder

    public class RepoBuilderDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements RepoBuilder
    This class is used to build Repo objects.
    Author:
    Rick Hightower

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean cache
      Turns caching on.
      (package private) boolean cloneEdits
      If you turn this on, then every time an object is sent to be edited or added it is cloned.

      Holds a collection of comparators that will be used per property for the Repo.

      For non-unique indexes, this sets up how many values you would like the index to hold initially.

      Lookup index factory.

      This holds a set of nestedIndexes.

      Sets the Object Editor Factory

      Primary key for this object.

      This is the Searchable Collection that the data repo uses that we are constructing.

      • searchIndexes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> searchIndexes
        This holds the set of search indexes that the Repo will manage

      • lookupIndexes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> lookupIndexes
        This holds the set of lookupIndexes that the Repo will manage.

      • uniqueSearchIndexes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> uniqueSearchIndexes
        This holds the uniqueSearchIndexes that this repo will manage.

      • uniqueLookupIndexes

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> uniqueLookupIndexes
        This holds the uniqueLookupIndexes that this repo will manager.

      • keyGetterMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Function> keyGetterMap
        If we are dealing with a complex key, like a derived key or some sort of fancy nested and/or composite key, then we just tell the Repo how to access the key with this here map. This maps property names to a Function (just like a method pointer that returns something. In our case, they give us the key and the Function gives them the value of the key.

      • useField

        boolean useField
        Sets if we should use the field directly.

      • useUnSafe

        boolean useUnSafe
        Sets if we should use unsafe (fast) access to the field.

      • nullChecksAndLogging

        boolean nullChecksAndLogging
        Checks to see if we should enable runtime null checking and logging This essentially means that we will not allow null keys or values.

      • cloneEdits

        boolean cloneEdits
        If you turn this on, then every time an object is sent to be edited or added it is cloned. In a multi-threaded application, this should prevent MT from accessing objects that is in the data repo.

      • storeKeyInIndexOnly

        boolean storeKeyInIndexOnly
        This is not implemented yet. It would allow to have only keys in the repo and the actual data could live elsewhere like a cache or an off JVM heap RAM location. It is is in the plans.

      • debug

        boolean debug
        This would turn on extra debugging.

      • level

        java.util.logging.Level level
        This sets up the log level for the builder.

      • fields

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FieldAccess> fields
        This keeps a list of fields that we are reading per object.
        See Also:
        FieldAccess

      • repo

        private RepoComposer repo
        This provides an interface to the composable nature of a Repo.
        See Also:
        RepoComposer

      • editor

        private ObjectEditor editor
        This is the Object editor that we are constructing.
        See Also:
        ObjectEditor

      • query

        private SearchableCollectionComposer query
        This is the Searchable Collection that the data repo uses that we are constructing.
        See Also:
        SearchableCollection

      • cache

        private boolean cache
        Turns caching on. Caching is very rudimentary at this point. This can cache complex queries and hold on the results until there is an update.

      • collators

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Comparator> collators
        Holds a collection of comparators that will be used per property for the Repo.

      • keyTransformers

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Function> keyTransformers
        Holds a collection of key transformers per property for the Repo. Key transformers are used to for example make a case insensitive search. It determines how the key is indexed.

      • nestedIndexes

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> nestedIndexes
        This holds a set of nestedIndexes. Employee.address.zip would be a nested index.

      • indexHierarchy

        private boolean indexHierarchy
        Turning on this flag, turns on indexing type hierarchy.

      • indexBucketSize

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> indexBucketSize
        For non-unique indexes, this sets up how many values you would like the index to hold initially. (It expands automatically).

      • hashCodeOptimizationOn

        private boolean hashCodeOptimizationOn
        Turns on hashCode Optimization. This means we will try to store the hashCode, and hold on to it unless the object changes.

      • removeDuplication

        private boolean removeDuplication
        If you want duplicates removed from query results.

      • events

        boolean events
        turn on modification events listenting.

      • listeners

        ModificationListener[] listeners
        Listen to modification changes.

      • cloneEdits

        public RepoBuilder cloneEdits(boolean cloneEdits)
        Clones the object in the repo before editing and also clones returns values. This should limit two threads from getting the same object that is in the repo.
